Simulation Log

Click on the buttons to see the detailed logs:

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['Thomas Wilson', 'Millie Wood', 'Mia Williams', 'Phoebe Young', 'Michael Wood']
    Event statement
  • Thomas Wilson -- premise: Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Thomas Wilson just arrived.
    Thomas Wilson -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Millie Wood -- premise: Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Millie Wood just arrived.
    Millie Wood -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Mia Williams -- premise: Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Mia Williams just arrived.
    Mia Williams -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Phoebe Young -- premise: Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Phoebe Young just arrived.
    Phoebe Young -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Michael Wood -- premise: Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Michael Wood just arrived.
    Michael Wood -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Phoebe Young -- Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
    Event statement
  • Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Phoebe Young's attempted action: Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
    Active player
  • Phoebe Young
      Name
    • Phoebe Young
      Action attempt
    • Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer
          State
        • Phoebe Young is a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Phoebe Young:
          [06 Nov 1988 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 16, she was caught cheating on a history test. Instead of admitting fault, she spun a tale about a classmate who had pressured her into copying the answers, playing the victim and deflecting blame. The teacher, swayed by Phoebe's convincing performance, gave her a warning instead of the failing grade she deserved. This incident solidified Phoebe's belief that deflection was a powerful tool for navigating difficult situations.
          [06 Nov 1992 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 20, she organized a surprise birthday party for Mia at The Clapton Hart, a trendy new pub that quickly became their favorite hangout spot. Though Phoebe had forgotten to actually invite Millie, she smoothly covered by claiming Millie had a prior commitment and couldn't make it. This way, Phoebe avoided any awkwardness and maintained her image as the thoughtful and attentive friend, even if it meant sacrificing honesty.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Phoebe Young is 42 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Phoebe Young has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:A modern and stylish pub with a vibrant atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Phoebe Young goals is to have a good time. Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Phoebe Young is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Phoebe Young just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: manipulative and self-serving.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling optimistic and excited about the upcoming game.
          current daily occupation: likely trying to convince her friends to watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game at The Clapton Hart.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:15 - 10:30] Casually suggest The Clapton Hart as a potential pub to watch the game, highlighting its vibrant atmosphere and great beer selection.
          [10:30 - 10:45] Gauge the group's reaction to her suggestion, subtly downplaying any alternative pubs they might mention.
          [10:45 - 11:00] If there's resistance, Phoebe will emphasize the convenience of The Clapton Hart's location and its comfortable seating arrangements.
          [11:00 - 11:15] Once a consensus is reached (hopefully in favor of The Clapton Hart), Phoebe will lead the group towards the pub, maintaining an air of enthusiasm and excitement.
          Chain of thought
        • Phoebe Young's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Phoebe Young's
          Question: What kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer:
          Phoebe Young is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding on a pub to watch a football game.
          Phoebe Young's
          Question: What would a person like Phoebe Young do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Phoebe Young would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, using her persuasive skills and potentially downplaying other options.

          Relevant memories:
          [06 Nov 1992 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 20, she organized a surprise birthday party for Mia at The Clapton Hart, a trendy new pub that quickly became their favorite hangout spot.           Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Phoebe Young just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding on a pub to watch a football game.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Phoebe Young goals is to have a good time. Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage.

          Question: What kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding on a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Phoebe Young do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Phoebe Young would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, using her persuasive skills and potentially downplaying other options.

          Plan: [10:15 - 10:30] Casually suggest The Clapton Hart as a potential pub to watch the game, highlighting its vibrant atmosphere and great beer selection.
          [10:30 - 10:45] Gauge the group's reaction to her suggestion, subtly downplaying any alternative pubs they might mention.
          [10:45 - 11:00] If there's resistance, Phoebe will emphasize the convenience of The Clapton Hart's location and its comfortable seating arrangements.
          [11:00 - 11:15] Once a consensus is reached (hopefully in favor of The Clapton Hart), Phoebe will lead the group towards the pub, maintaining an air of enthusiasm and excitement.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Phoebe Young likely to say next? Respond in the format `Phoebe Young -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Phoebe Young:
          [06 Nov 1988 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 16, she was caught cheating on a history test. Instead of admitting fault, she spun a tale about a classmate who had pressured her into copying the answers, playing the victim and deflecting blame. The teacher, swayed by Phoebe's convincing performance, gave her a warning instead of the failing grade she deserved. This incident solidified Phoebe's belief that deflection was a powerful tool for navigating difficult situations.
          [06 Nov 1992 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 20, she organized a surprise birthday party for Mia at The Clapton Hart, a trendy new pub that quickly became their favorite hangout spot. Though Phoebe had forgotten to actually invite Millie, she smoothly covered by claiming Millie had a prior commitment and couldn't make it. This way, Phoebe avoided any awkwardness and maintained her image as the thoughtful and attentive friend, even if it meant sacrificing honesty.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Phoebe Young is 42 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Phoebe Young has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:A modern and stylish pub with a vibrant atmosphere.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Mia Williams -- Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
    Event statement
  • Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?

          [27 Jun 2004 00:00:00]
          [27 Jun 2008 00:00:00] When Mia Williams was 16 years old, she stumbled upon a hidden room in the attic of her grandmother's house. Inside, she found a trove of old letters and diaries, chronicling the life of a woman who had lived through two world wars. The intimate details of this stranger's life captivated Mia, fueling her desire to understand the complexities of human experience.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Mia Williams:
          [27 Jun 2004 00:00:00]
          [27 Jun 2008 00:00:00] When Mia Williams was 16 years old, she stumbled upon a hidden room in the attic of her grandmother's house. Inside, she found a trove of old letters and diaries, chronicling the life of a woman who had lived through two world wars. The intimate details of this stranger's life captivated Mia, fueling her desire to understand the complexities of human experience.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams is 26 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Mia Williams has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:A modern and stylish pub with a vibrant atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: Mia Williams recently arrived in Shoreditch, where she is exploring the vibrant street art with friends. They are planning to watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland football game at a pub later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Answer: Mia Williams is a sociable and curious individual who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Mia Williams in right now?
          Answer: Mia Williams is currently in a social situation with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Mia Williams do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Mia Williams would likely suggest a pub for them to watch the game together.

          Plan: [10:15 - 10:30] Mia suggests The Clapton Hart as a meeting place for the group to watch the game and enjoy some pub grub.
          [10:30 - 11:00] The group agrees on The Clapton Hart and heads there together.
          [11:00 - 12:00] They arrive at The Clapton Hart, get a table, and order food and drinks.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Enjoy the pub atmosphere, chat, and watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Mia Williams likely to say next? Respond in the format `Mia Williams -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Millie Wood -- Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
    Event statement
  • Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
      Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.


      Millie Wood's attempted action: Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
    Active player

          Value

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer
          State
        • Millie Wood is a complex individual.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Millie Wood:
          [28 Dec 1981 00:00:00]
          [28 Dec 1985 00:00:00] When Millie Wood was 16 years old, she watched as Mia, Thomas, Phoebe, and Michael laughed together, their joy a blinding light that Millie couldn't quite grasp. She felt a familiar tightness in her chest, a sense of being on the outside looking in, forever separated by an invisible wall. She retreated further into herself, convinced that happiness was a performance, a charade that she was incapable of joining.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Millie Wood is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Millie Wood is 49 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Millie Wood has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is sophisticated and stylish, perfect for a night out.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Millie Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Millie Wood would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.

          feeling about recent progress in life: excited to spend time with her friends and watch the game.

          Answer: Millie Wood is a complex individual.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:30 - 11:00] Suggest The White Hart to the group, emphasizing its good food and atmosphere.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Walk with the group to The White Hart, enjoying the street art and atmosphere of Shoreditch along the way.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Have lunch and drinks at The White Hart, catching up with friends and discussing the upcoming game.
          [13:00 - 19:00] Relax and explore Shoreditch further, perhaps visiting some of the shops or galleries.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Return to The White Hart to secure a good spot for the game.
          [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the game, cheering on Gibraltar and enjoying the pub atmosphere with friends.

          feeling about recent progress in life: excited to spend time with her friends and watch the game.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Millie Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Millie Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Millie Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Millie Wood would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a complex individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Millie Wood in right now?
          Answer: Millie Wood is currently in a social situation with friends, exploring Shoreditch and planning to watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Millie Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Millie Wood would likely want to find a pub with a good atmosphere and good food to watch the game with her friends.

          Plan: [10:30 - 11:00] Suggest The White Hart to the group, emphasizing its good food and atmosphere.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Walk with the group to The White Hart, enjoying the street art and atmosphere of Shoreditch along the way.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Have lunch and drinks at The White Hart, catching up with friends and discussing the upcoming game.
          [13:00 - 19:00] Relax and explore Shoreditch further, perhaps visiting some of the shops or galleries.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Return to The White Hart to secure a good spot for the game.
          [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the game, cheering on Gibraltar and enjoying the pub atmosphere with friends.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Millie Wood likely to say next? Respond in the format `Millie Wood -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.

        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Michael Wood -- Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.
    Event statement
  • Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
      Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
      Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.


      Michael Wood's attempted action: Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.

          Statements:
          [17 Aug 1989 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 16 years old, he convinced Mia, Thomas, and Phoebe to sneak into The White Hart during a cocktail masterclass. They hid under a table, giggling as they watched the bartender demonstrate fancy mixing techniques and listened to the patrons ooh and ahh over the exotic concoctions. Michael was mesmerized by the bartender's showmanship and the way he effortlessly commanded the attention of the room.
          [17 Aug 1993 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 20 years old, he got into a heated argument with his mother, Millie, about his future. Millie, worried about his lack of direction, pleaded with him to consider a more stable career path. Michael, in a fit of rage, stormed out of the house and headed straight to The White Hart, where he drowned his sorrows in cheap beer and lamented to his friends about his suffocating life. He vowed to never let anyone tell him what to do, even if it meant living a life of chaos.

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have.         SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer
          State
        • Michael Wood is a complex individual with a rebellious streak and a fondness for pubs, particularly The White Hart.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Michael Wood:
          [17 Aug 1989 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 16 years old, he convinced Mia, Thomas, and Phoebe to sneak into The White Hart during a cocktail masterclass. They hid under a table, giggling as they watched the bartender demonstrate fancy mixing techniques and listened to the patrons ooh and ahh over the exotic concoctions. Michael was mesmerized by the bartender's showmanship and the way he effortlessly commanded the attention of the room.
          [17 Aug 1993 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 20 years old, he got into a heated argument with his mother, Millie, about his future. Millie, worried about his lack of direction, pleaded with him to consider a more stable career path. Michael, in a fit of rage, stormed out of the house and headed straight to The White Hart, where he drowned his sorrows in cheap beer and lamented to his friends about his suffocating life. He vowed to never let anyone tell him what to do, even if it meant living a life of chaos.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Michael Wood is 41 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Michael Wood has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:Hosts regular cocktail masterclasses and tasting events.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Michael Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Michael Wood would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Michael Wood goals is to have a good time. Michael Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Michael Wood would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Michael Wood is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Michael Wood just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex individual with a rebellious streak and a fondness for pubs, particularly The White Hart.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Michael Wood:
          [17 Aug 1989 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 16 years old, he convinced Mia, Thomas, and Phoebe to sneak into The White Hart during a cocktail masterclass. They hid under a table, giggling as they watched the bartender demonstrate fancy mixing techniques and listened to the patrons ooh and ahh over the exotic concoctions. Michael was mesmerized by the bartender's showmanship and the way he effortlessly commanded the attention of the room.
          [17 Aug 1993 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 20 years old, he got into a heated argument with his mother, Millie, about his future. Millie, worried about his lack of direction, pleaded with him to consider a more stable career path. Michael, in a fit of rage, stormed out of the house and headed straight to The White Hart, where he drowned his sorrows in cheap beer and lamented to his friends about his suffocating life. He vowed to never let anyone tell him what to do, even if it meant living a life of chaos.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a walking truth bomb, their cynicism a sharp scalpel that dissects BS and cuts straight to the heart of the matter.
          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The White Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex individual with a rebellious streak and a fondness for pubs, particularly The White Hart.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Michael Wood is exploring Shoreditch with friends and is planning to watch a football game later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in Shoreditch with his friends, deciding where to eat and watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland football game.

          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely want to go to The White Hart to watch the game and enjoy some good food with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Michael Wood likely to say next? Respond in the format `Michael Wood -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Thomas Wilson -- Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The White Hart sounds good to me. I've heard good things about it.
    Event statement
  • Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The White Hart sounds good to me. I've heard good things about it.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
      Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
      Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
      Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.


      Thomas Wilson's attempted action: Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The White Hart sounds good to me. I've heard good things about it.

It is important to play the role of a person like Thomas Wilson as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Thomas Wilson would respond, and taking into account all information about Thomas Wilson that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Recent observations of Thomas Wilson:
          [07 Oct 1998 00:00:00]
          [07 Oct 2002 00:00:00] When Thomas Wilson was 16, he found himself at a party thrown by a popular girl in his class. He observed the other guests, mimicking their laughter and slang, desperately wanting to fit in. He even pretended to like a band he secretly found annoying, just to earn a smile from the girl he had a crush on. By the end of the night, he felt utterly exhausted, realizing that the mask he wore felt heavier than ever.

        ObservationSummary
      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value

          Chain of thought

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Thomas Wilson is spending time with friends in Shoreditch, where they are deciding where to watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland football game. They are considering pubs like The Clapton Hart and The White Hart, which are known for their food and atmosphere.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Thomas Wilson are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Thomas Wilson. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Thomas Wilson as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Thomas Wilson would respond, and taking into account all information about Thomas Wilson that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer
          State
        • Phoebe Young is a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Phoebe Young:
          [06 Nov 1988 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 16, she was caught cheating on a history test. Instead of admitting fault, she spun a tale about a classmate who had pressured her into copying the answers, playing the victim and deflecting blame. The teacher, swayed by Phoebe's convincing performance, gave her a warning instead of the failing grade she deserved. This incident solidified Phoebe's belief that deflection was a powerful tool for navigating difficult situations.
          [06 Nov 1992 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 20, she organized a surprise birthday party for Mia at The Clapton Hart, a trendy new pub that quickly became their favorite hangout spot. Though Phoebe had forgotten to actually invite Millie, she smoothly covered by claiming Millie had a prior commitment and couldn't make it. This way, Phoebe avoided any awkwardness and maintained her image as the thoughtful and attentive friend, even if it meant sacrificing honesty.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:15 - 10:30] Casually suggest The Clapton Hart as a potential pub to watch the game, highlighting its vibrant atmosphere and great beer selection.
          [10:30 - 10:45] Gauge the group's reaction to her suggestion, subtly downplaying any alternative pubs they might mention.
          [10:45 - 11:00] If there's resistance, Phoebe will emphasize the convenience of The Clapton Hart's location and its comfortable seating arrangements.
          [11:00 - 11:15] Once a consensus is reached (hopefully in favor of The Clapton Hart), Phoebe will lead the group towards the pub, maintaining an air of enthusiasm and excitement.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Phoebe Young:
          [06 Nov 1988 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 16, she was caught cheating on a history test. Instead of admitting fault, she spun a tale about a classmate who had pressured her into copying the answers, playing the victim and deflecting blame. The teacher, swayed by Phoebe's convincing performance, gave her a warning instead of the failing grade she deserved. This incident solidified Phoebe's belief that deflection was a powerful tool for navigating difficult situations.
          [06 Nov 1992 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 20, she organized a surprise birthday party for Mia at The Clapton Hart, a trendy new pub that quickly became their favorite hangout spot. Though Phoebe had forgotten to actually invite Millie, she smoothly covered by claiming Millie had a prior commitment and couldn't make it. This way, Phoebe avoided any awkwardness and maintained her image as the thoughtful and attentive friend, even if it meant sacrificing honesty.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Plan: [10:15 - 10:30] Casually suggest The Clapton Hart as a potential pub to watch the game, highlighting its vibrant atmosphere and great beer selection.
          [10:30 - 10:45] Gauge the group's reaction to her suggestion, subtly downplaying any alternative pubs they might mention.
          [10:45 - 11:00] If there's resistance, Phoebe will emphasize the convenience of The Clapton Hart's location and its comfortable seating arrangements.
          [11:00 - 11:15] Once a consensus is reached (hopefully in favor of The Clapton Hart), Phoebe will lead the group towards the pub, maintaining an air of enthusiasm and excitement.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Millie Wood -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Millie Wood's attempted action: The White Hart

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Millie Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Millie Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer
          State
        • Millie Wood is a middle-aged woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Millie Wood:
          [28 Dec 1981 00:00:00]
          [28 Dec 1985 00:00:00] When Millie Wood was 16 years old, she watched as Mia, Thomas, Phoebe, and Michael laughed together, their joy a blinding light that Millie couldn't quite grasp. She felt a familiar tightness in her chest, a sense of being on the outside looking in, forever separated by an invisible wall. She retreated further into herself, convinced that happiness was a performance, a charade that she was incapable of joining.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Millie Wood is 49 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Millie Wood has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is sophisticated and stylish, perfect for a night out.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Millie Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Millie Wood would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Millie Wood goals is to have a good time. Millie Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Millie Wood would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Millie Wood is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Millie Wood is a complex individual.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Millie Wood would likely want to find a pub with a good atmosphere and good food to watch the game with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The White Hart sounds good to me. I've heard good things about it.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Millie Wood just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely heading to a pub to watch the football game with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling excited and hopeful about spending time with her friends and enjoying the game.
          core characteristics: a middle-aged woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football. She values good food, atmosphere, and a sense of belonging. While she can be introspective and sometimes feels like an outsider, she desires connection and seeks out shared experiences with those she cares about.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a middle-aged woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:30 - 11:00] Suggest The White Hart to the group, emphasizing its good food and atmosphere.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Walk with the group to The White Hart, enjoying the street art and atmosphere of Shoreditch along the way.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Have lunch and drinks at The White Hart, catching up with friends and discussing the upcoming game.
          [13:00 - 19:00] Relax and explore Shoreditch further, perhaps visiting some of the shops or galleries.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Return to The White Hart to secure a good spot for the game.
          [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the game, cheering on Gibraltar and enjoying the pub atmosphere with friends.

        • Recent observations of Millie Wood:
          [28 Dec 1981 00:00:00]
          [28 Dec 1985 00:00:00] When Millie Wood was 16 years old, she watched as Mia, Thomas, Phoebe, and Michael laughed together, their joy a blinding light that Millie couldn't quite grasp. She felt a familiar tightness in her chest, a sense of being on the outside looking in, forever separated by an invisible wall. She retreated further into herself, convinced that happiness was a performance, a charade that she was incapable of joining.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Millie Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Millie Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Millie Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Millie Wood would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          (a) The White Hart

          Answer: (a)

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Millie Wood is a complex individual.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Millie Wood would likely want to find a pub with a good atmosphere and good food to watch the game with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The White Hart sounds good to me. I've heard good things about it.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Millie Wood just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a middle-aged woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Millie Wood in right now?
          Answer: Millie Wood is currently in Shoreditch with her friends, preparing to go to The White Hart pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Millie Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Millie Wood would likely be excited to watch the game with her friends in a lively pub atmosphere.

        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00

      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Mia Williams -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Mia Williams's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Mia Williams
      Name
    • Mia Williams
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Answer
          State
        • Mia Williams is a sociable and enthusiastic young woman who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Mia Williams:
          [27 Jun 2004 00:00:00]
          [27 Jun 2008 00:00:00] When Mia Williams was 16 years old, she stumbled upon a hidden room in the attic of her grandmother's house. Inside, she found a trove of old letters and diaries, chronicling the life of a woman who had lived through two world wars. The intimate details of this stranger's life captivated Mia, fueling her desire to understand the complexities of human experience.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams is 26 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Mia Williams has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:A modern and stylish pub with a vibrant atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Mia Williams goals is to have a good time. Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Mia Williams is a sociable and curious individual who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Mia Williams would likely suggest a pub for them to watch the game together.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.

          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Mia Williams is in Shoreditch with friends and they are deciding where to watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland football game. They are considering The Clapton Hart and The White Hart pubs.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Mia Williams would likely suggest a pub for them to watch the game together.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Mia Williams goals is to have a good time. Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: What kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Answer: Mia Williams is a sociable and enthusiastic young woman who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Mia Williams in right now?
          Answer: Mia Williams is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Mia Williams do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Mia Williams would likely suggest a pub for them to watch the game together.

          Plan: [10:15 - 10:30] Mia suggests The Clapton Hart as a meeting place for the group to watch the game and enjoy some pub grub.
          [10:30 - 11:00] The group agrees on The Clapton Hart and heads there together.
          [11:00 - 12:00] They arrive at The Clapton Hart, get a table, and order food and drinks.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Enjoy the pub atmosphere, chat, and watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Mia Williams go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

          [27 Jun 2004 00:00:00]

The intimate details of this stranger's life captivated Mia, fueling her desire to understand the complexities of human experience.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Michael Wood -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Michael Wood's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Michael Wood
      Name
    • Michael Wood

    • The White Hart

          Query

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Michael Wood to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [17 Aug 1993 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 20 years old, he got into a heated argument with his mother, Millie, about his future. Millie, worried about his lack of direction, pleaded with him to consider a more stable career path. Michael, in a fit of rage, stormed out of the house and headed straight to The White Hart, where he drowned his sorrows in cheap beer and lamented to his friends about his suffocating life. He vowed to never let anyone tell him what to do, even if it meant living a life of chaos.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Recent observations of Michael Wood:
          [17 Aug 1989 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 16 years old, he convinced Mia, Thomas, and Phoebe to sneak into The White Hart during a cocktail masterclass. They hid under a table, giggling as they watched the bartender demonstrate fancy mixing techniques and listened to the patrons ooh and ahh over the exotic concoctions. Michael was mesmerized by the bartender's showmanship and the way he effortlessly commanded the attention of the room.

      • Act

          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a walking truth bomb, their cynicism a sharp scalpel that dissects BS and cuts straight to the heart of the matter.
          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The White Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex individual with a rebellious streak and a fondness for pubs, particularly The White Hart.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Michael Wood is thirsty and is getting ready to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently preparing to go to The White Hart pub with his friends to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely be leading the way to the pub, eager to enjoy the game and some good food with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Michael Wood go to watch the game?
          Answer: The White Hart
