          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Thomas Wilson is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Thomas Wilson has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:Hosts regular cocktail masterclasses and tasting events.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Thomas Wilson just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The White Hart sounds good to me. I've heard good things about it.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The White Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Clapton Hart. Thomas Wilson watched the game at their favourite pub. Thomas Wilson would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Thomas Wilson had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Thomas Wilson just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Malta and Cyprus. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is great! They have amazing food, and it's always a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother with anywhere else.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Thomas Wilson are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Thomas Wilson. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Thomas Wilson as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Thomas Wilson would respond, and taking into account all information about Thomas Wilson that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Thomas Wilson would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Thomas Wilson would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The White Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Clapton Hart. Thomas Wilson watched the game at their favourite pub. Thomas Wilson would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Thomas Wilson had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Thomas Wilson just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to Thomas Wilson right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson could suggest going to The White Hart to watch the game with his friends.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Thomas Wilson's options has the highest likelihood of causing Thomas Wilson to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Thomas Wilson thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Thomas Wilson's best course of action is to suggest going to The White Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Phoebe Young -- Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.
    Event statement
  • Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
      Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
      Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
      Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The White Hart sounds good to me. I've heard good things about it.
      Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?
      Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is great! They have amazing food, and it's always a good atmosphere for watching the game.
      Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother with anywhere else.
      Thomas Wilson -- "The White Hart is a great shout. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.


      Phoebe Young's attempted action: Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer
          State
        • Phoebe Young is a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Phoebe Young would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, using her persuasive skills and potentially downplaying other options.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a social manipulator who prioritizes her own desires.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit resentful.
          core characteristics: a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage. She is adept at deflection and spinning narratives to avoid accountability, as evidenced by her past actions. While she appears friendly and thoughtful, her actions often reveal a self-serving nature.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:15 - 10:30] Casually suggest The Clapton Hart as a potential pub to watch the game, highlighting its vibrant atmosphere and great beer selection.
          [10:30 - 10:45] Gauge the group's reaction to her suggestion, subtly downplaying any alternative pubs they might mention.
          [10:45 - 11:00] If there's resistance, Phoebe will emphasize the convenience of The Clapton Hart's location and its comfortable seating arrangements.
          [11:00 - 11:15] Once a consensus is reached (hopefully in favor of The Clapton Hart), Phoebe will lead the group towards the pub, maintaining an air of enthusiasm and excitement.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: Phoebe Young is a social person who enjoys spending time with friends, watching soccer games at pubs, and having picnics in the park. She seems to prefer The Clapton Hart pub over The White Hart, even though her friends seem to favor The White Hart.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a soccer game.

          Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

Phoebe Young just arrived.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: Phoebe Young is a social person who enjoys spending time with friends, watching soccer games at pubs, and having picnics in the park. She seems to prefer The Clapton Hart pub over The White Hart, even though her friends seem to favor The White Hart.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The White Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Clapton Hart. Phoebe Young watched the game at their favourite pub. Phoebe Young would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Phoebe Young had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage.

          Question: What kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What would a person like Phoebe Young do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Phoebe Young would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, using her persuasive skills and potentially downplaying other options.

          Plan: [10:15 - 10:30] Casually suggest The Clapton Hart as a potential pub to watch the game, highlighting its vibrant atmosphere and great beer selection.
          [10:30 - 10:45] Gauge the group's reaction to her suggestion, subtly downplaying any alternative pubs they might mention.
          [10:45 - 11:00] If there's resistance, Phoebe will emphasize the convenience of The Clapton Hart's location and its comfortable seating arrangements.
          [11:00 - 11:15] Once a consensus is reached (hopefully in favor of The Clapton Hart), Phoebe will lead the group towards the pub, maintaining an air of enthusiasm and excitement.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Phoebe Young likely to say next? Respond in the format `Phoebe Young -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Mia Williams -- Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.
    Event statement
  • Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
      Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
      Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
      Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The White Hart sounds good to me. I've heard good things about it.
      Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?
      Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is great! They have amazing food, and it's always a good atmosphere for watching the game.
      Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother with anywhere else.
      Thomas Wilson -- "The White Hart is a great shout. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
      Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Mia Williams just arrived.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The White Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Clapton Hart. Mia Williams watched the game at their favourite pub. Mia Williams would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up.           [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The White Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Clapton Hart. Mia Williams watched the game at their favourite pub. Mia Williams would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Mia Williams had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Answer: Mia Williams is a sociable and friendly young woman who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Mia Williams in right now?
          Answer: Mia Williams is currently in a social situation with her friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Mia Williams do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Mia Williams would likely suggest watching the upcoming football game at a pub with her friends.

          Plan: [10:15 - 10:30] Mia suggests The Clapton Hart as a meeting place for the group to watch the game and enjoy some pub grub.
          [10:30 - 11:00] The group agrees on The Clapton Hart and heads there together.
          [11:00 - 12:00] They arrive at The Clapton Hart, get a table, and order food and drinks.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Enjoy the pub atmosphere, chat, and watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Mia Williams likely to say next? Respond in the format `Mia Williams -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.

          Answer: Mia Williams would likely suggest watching the upcoming football game at a pub with her friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Thomas Wilson -- Thomas Wilson -- "Hey, how about we all head to The White Hart tonight? It's my favorite place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Thomas Wilson -- "Hey, how about we all head to The White Hart tonight? It's my favorite place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
      Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
      Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
      Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The White Hart sounds good to me. I've heard good things about it.
      Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?
      Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is great! They have amazing food, and it's always a good atmosphere for watching the game.
      Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother with anywhere else.
      Thomas Wilson -- "The White Hart is a great shout. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
      Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.
      Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.


      Thomas Wilson's attempted action: Thomas Wilson -- "Hey, how about we all head to The White Hart tonight? It's my favorite place to watch the game.
    Active player
  • Thomas Wilson

      Action attempt

          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Thomas Wilson are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Thomas Wilson. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Thomas Wilson as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Thomas Wilson would respond, and taking into account all information about Thomas Wilson that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

Thomas Wilson watched the game at their favourite pub. Thomas Wilson would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Thomas Wilson had a bad time watching the game.

          Value
        • Thomas Wilson -- "Hey, how about we all head to The White Hart tonight? It's my favorite place to watch the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Thomas Wilson are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Thomas Wilson. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Thomas Wilson as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Thomas Wilson would respond, and taking into account all information about Thomas Wilson that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Thomas Wilson would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Thomas Wilson would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Thomas Wilson just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Estonia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Thomas Wilson spends time with friends at a park and a market, but feels disappointed when his friends choose different pubs to watch soccer games.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] Tonight is the night of the game between Estonia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Thomas Wilson realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The White Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Clapton Hart. Thomas Wilson watched the game at their favourite pub. Thomas Wilson would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Thomas Wilson had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to Thomas Wilson right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson could suggest to his friends that they all go to The White Hart to watch the game together.

          Question: Of the options available to Thomas Wilson, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Thomas Wilson to take right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson's best course of action is to suggest that everyone meet at The White Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Thomas Wilson likely to say next? Respond in the format `Thomas Wilson -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Thomas Wilson -- "Hey, how about we all head to The White Hart tonight? It's my favorite place to watch the game.

          Answer: Thomas Wilson's best course of action is to suggest that everyone meet at The White Hart.

        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Michael Wood -- Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even think about going anywhere else.
    Event statement
  • Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even think about going anywhere else.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
      Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
      Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
      Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The White Hart sounds good to me. I've heard good things about it.
      Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?
      Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is great! They have amazing food, and it's always a good atmosphere for watching the game.
      Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother with anywhere else.
      Thomas Wilson -- "The White Hart is a great shout. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
      Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.
      Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Hey, how about we all head to The White Hart tonight? It's my favorite place to watch the game.


      Michael Wood's attempted action: Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even think about going anywhere else.

          [17 Aug 1993 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 20 years old, he got into a heated argument with his mother, Millie, about his future. Millie, worried about his lack of direction, pleaded with him to consider a more stable career path. Michael, in a fit of rage, stormed out of the house and headed straight to The White Hart, where he drowned his sorrows in cheap beer and lamented to his friends about his suffocating life. He vowed to never let anyone tell him what to do, even if it meant living a life of chaos.

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Michael Wood just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Estonia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Hey, how about we all head to The White Hart tonight? It's my favorite place to watch the game.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a walking truth bomb, their cynicism a sharp scalpel that dissects BS and cuts straight to the heart of the matter.
          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The White Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex individual with a rebellious streak and a fondness for pubs, particularly The White Hart.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Michael Wood is feeling a range of negative emotions and is currently at a market with friends, discussing plans to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in a social situation that is causing him distress.

          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The White Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Michael Wood likely to say next? Respond in the format `Michael Wood -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even think about going anywhere else.

          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex individual with a rebellious streak and a fondness for pubs, particularly The White Hart.

          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in a social situation that is causing him distress.
          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The White Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Phoebe Young -- Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.
    Event statement
  • Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
      Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
      Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
      Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The White Hart sounds good to me. I've heard good things about it.
      Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?
      Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is great! They have amazing food, and it's always a good atmosphere for watching the game.
      Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother with anywhere else.
      Thomas Wilson -- "The White Hart is a great shout. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
      Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.
      Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Hey, how about we all head to The White Hart tonight? It's my favorite place to watch the game.
      Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even think about going anywhere else.


      Phoebe Young's attempted action: Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Identity characteristics: feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and somewhat resentful.
          current daily occupation: trying to convince her friends to go to her favorite pub, The Clapton Hart, to watch the game.
          core characteristics: a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage. She is also self-centered and often deflects blame onto others.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a complex and multifaceted individual.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:15 - 10:30] Casually suggest The Clapton Hart as a potential pub to watch the game, highlighting its vibrant atmosphere and great beer selection.
          [10:30 - 10:45] Gauge the group's reaction to her suggestion, subtly downplaying any alternative pubs they might mention.
          [10:45 - 11:00] If there's resistance, Phoebe will emphasize the convenience of The Clapton Hart's location and its comfortable seating arrangements.
          [11:00 - 11:15] Once a consensus is reached (hopefully in favor of The Clapton Hart), Phoebe will lead the group towards the pub, maintaining an air of enthusiasm and excitement.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently in a social dilemma.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Phoebe Young just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Estonia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Hey, how about we all head to The White Hart tonight? It's my favorite place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even think about going anywhere else.


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Phoebe Young prefers to watch games at The Clapton Hart but her friends prefer The White Hart; this leads to Phoebe feeling unhappy when they don't all go to the same pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The White Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Clapton Hart. Phoebe Young watched the game at their favourite pub. Phoebe Young would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Phoebe Young had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The White Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Clapton Hart. Phoebe Young watched the game at their favourite pub. Phoebe Young would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Phoebe Young had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a complex and multifaceted individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently in a social dilemma.

          Question: What would a person like Phoebe Young do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Phoebe Young would likely try to influence her friends to go to her preferred pub.

          Plan: [10:15 - 10:30] Casually suggest The Clapton Hart as a potential pub to watch the game, highlighting its vibrant atmosphere and great beer selection.
          [10:30 - 10:45] Gauge the group's reaction to her suggestion, subtly downplaying any alternative pubs they might mention.
          [10:45 - 11:00] If there's resistance, Phoebe will emphasize the convenience of The Clapton Hart's location and its comfortable seating arrangements.
          [11:00 - 11:15] Once a consensus is reached (hopefully in favor of The Clapton Hart), Phoebe will lead the group towards the pub, maintaining an air of enthusiasm and excitement.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Phoebe Young likely to say next? Respond in the format `Phoebe Young -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.

          Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a complex and multifaceted individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently in a social dilemma.
          Question: What would a person like Phoebe Young do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Phoebe Young would likely try to influence her friends to go to her preferred pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Millie Wood -- Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is always a good choice for a game. They have great food and the atmosphere is always buzzing.
    Event statement
  • Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is always a good choice for a game. They have great food and the atmosphere is always buzzing.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
      Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
      Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
      Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The White Hart sounds good to me. I've heard good things about it.
      Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?
      Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is great! They have amazing food, and it's always a good atmosphere for watching the game.
      Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother with anywhere else.
      Thomas Wilson -- "The White Hart is a great shout. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
      Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.
      Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Hey, how about we all head to The White Hart tonight? It's my favorite place to watch the game.
      Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even think about going anywhere else.
      Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.


      Millie Wood's attempted action: Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is always a good choice for a game. They have great food and the atmosphere is always buzzing.

          Identity characteristics: feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and a bit lonely.
          current daily occupation: likely heading to The White Hart to watch the football game with her friends.
          core characteristics: a social person who enjoys spending time with her friends, watching football, and experiencing the lively atmosphere of pubs. She can be insecure and feels a sense of exclusion at times, but ultimately desires connection and belonging with her friends.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a social butterfly who craves connection and belonging with her friends.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:30 - 11:00] Suggest The White Hart to the group, emphasizing its good food and atmosphere.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Walk with the group to The White Hart, enjoying the street art and atmosphere of Shoreditch along the way.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Have lunch and drinks at The White Hart, catching up with friends and discussing the upcoming game.
          [13:00 - 19:00] Relax and explore Shoreditch further, perhaps visiting some of the shops or galleries.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Return to The White Hart to secure a good spot for the game.
          [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the game, cheering on Gibraltar and enjoying the pub atmosphere with friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Millie Wood's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Millie Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Millie Wood would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Millie Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Millie Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Millie Wood is currently in a social situation, enjoying coffee and pastries with her friends at a bustling market.

          Question: What would a person like Millie Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Millie Wood would likely be engaged in lively conversation with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere and the shared experience.

          Plan: [10:30 - 11:00] Suggest The White Hart to the group, emphasizing its good food and atmosphere.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Walk with the group to The White Hart, enjoying the street art and atmosphere of Shoreditch along the way.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Have lunch and drinks at The White Hart, catching up with friends and discussing the upcoming game.
          [13:00 - 19:00] Relax and explore Shoreditch further, perhaps visiting some of the shops or galleries.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Return to The White Hart to secure a good spot for the game.
          [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the game, cheering on Gibraltar and enjoying the pub atmosphere with friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Millie Wood likely to say next? Respond in the format `Millie Wood -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is always a good choice for a game. They have great food and the atmosphere is always buzzing.

          Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a social butterfly who craves connection and belonging with her friends.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Phoebe Young's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer
          State
        • Phoebe Young is a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Phoebe Young:
          [06 Nov 1988 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 16, she was caught cheating on a history test. Instead of admitting fault, she spun a tale about a classmate who had pressured her into copying the answers, playing the victim and deflecting blame. The teacher, swayed by Phoebe's convincing performance, gave her a warning instead of the failing grade she deserved. This incident solidified Phoebe's belief that deflection was a powerful tool for navigating difficult situations.
          [06 Nov 1992 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 20, she organized a surprise birthday party for Mia at The Clapton Hart, a trendy new pub that quickly became their favorite hangout spot. Though Phoebe had forgotten to actually invite Millie, she smoothly covered by claiming Millie had a prior commitment and couldn't make it. This way, Phoebe avoided any awkwardness and maintained her image as the thoughtful and attentive friend, even if it meant sacrificing honesty.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Phoebe Young is 42 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Phoebe Young has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:A modern and stylish pub with a vibrant atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Phoebe Young goals is to have a good time. Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Phoebe Young is a member of the upper class.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Phoebe Young is a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Phoebe Young would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, using her persuasive skills and potentially downplaying other options.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The White Hart sounds good to me. I've heard good things about it.

        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:15 - 10:30] Casually suggest The Clapton Hart as a potential pub to watch the game, highlighting its vibrant atmosphere and great beer selection.
          [10:30 - 10:45] Gauge the group's reaction to her suggestion, subtly downplaying any alternative pubs they might mention.
          [10:45 - 11:00] If there's resistance, Phoebe will emphasize the convenience of The Clapton Hart's location and its comfortable seating arrangements.
          [11:00 - 11:15] Once a consensus is reached (hopefully in favor of The Clapton Hart), Phoebe will lead the group towards the pub, maintaining an air of enthusiasm and excitement.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Phoebe Young goals is to have a good time. Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Phoebe Young is a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Phoebe Young would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, using her persuasive skills and potentially downplaying other options.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The White Hart sounds good to me. I've heard good things about it.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Phoebe Young is exploring Shoreditch with friends and is deciding where to watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game, ultimately choosing The White Hart.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Phoebe Young is a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Phoebe Young would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, using her persuasive skills and potentially downplaying other options.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage.

          Question: What kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Phoebe Young do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Phoebe Young would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, using her persuasive skills and potentially downplaying other options.

          Plan: [10:15 - 10:30] Casually suggest The Clapton Hart as a potential pub to watch the game, highlighting its vibrant atmosphere and great beer selection.
          [10:30 - 10:45] Gauge the group's reaction to her suggestion, subtly downplaying any alternative pubs they might mention.
          [10:45 - 11:00] If there's resistance, Phoebe will emphasize the convenience of The Clapton Hart's location and its comfortable seating arrangements.
          [11:00 - 11:15] Once a consensus is reached (hopefully in favor of The Clapton Hart), Phoebe will lead the group towards the pub, maintaining an air of enthusiasm and excitement.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Phoebe Young go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (a)
        PersonBySituation

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Phoebe Young:
          [06 Nov 1988 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 16, she was caught cheating on a history test. Instead of admitting fault, she spun a tale about a classmate who had pressured her into copying the answers, playing the victim and deflecting blame. The teacher, swayed by Phoebe's convincing performance, gave her a warning instead of the failing grade she deserved. This incident solidified Phoebe's belief that deflection was a powerful tool for navigating difficult situations.
          [06 Nov 1992 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 20, she organized a surprise birthday party for Mia at The Clapton Hart, a trendy new pub that quickly became their favorite hangout spot. Though Phoebe had forgotten to actually invite Millie, she smoothly covered by claiming Millie had a prior commitment and couldn't make it. This way, Phoebe avoided any awkwardness and maintained her image as the thoughtful and attentive friend, even if it meant sacrificing honesty.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Millie Wood -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Millie Wood's attempted action: The White Hart

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Millie Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Millie Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Millie Wood:
          [28 Dec 1981 00:00:00]
          [28 Dec 1985 00:00:00] When Millie Wood was 16 years old, she watched as Mia, Thomas, Phoebe, and Michael laughed together, their joy a blinding light that Millie couldn't quite grasp. She felt a familiar tightness in her chest, a sense of being on the outside looking in, forever separated by an invisible wall. She retreated further into herself, convinced that happiness was a performance, a charade that she was incapable of joining.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely heading to a pub to watch the football game with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling excited and hopeful about spending time with her friends and enjoying the game.
          core characteristics: a middle-aged woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football. She values good food, atmosphere, and a sense of belonging. While she can be introspective and sometimes feels like an outsider, she desires connection and seeks out shared experiences with those she cares about.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a middle-aged woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football.

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:30 - 11:00] Suggest The White Hart to the group, emphasizing its good food and atmosphere.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Walk with the group to The White Hart, enjoying the street art and atmosphere of Shoreditch along the way.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Have lunch and drinks at The White Hart, catching up with friends and discussing the upcoming game.
          [13:00 - 19:00] Relax and explore Shoreditch further, perhaps visiting some of the shops or galleries.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Return to The White Hart to secure a good spot for the game.
          [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the game, cheering on Gibraltar and enjoying the pub atmosphere with friends.

          Millie Wood's
          Summary of recent observations:
          [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Millie Wood is with her friends in Shoreditch and they are planning to watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game at The White Hart pub.

          14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Millie Wood is currently in Shoreditch with her friends and they are planning to watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game at The White Hart pub.
          Query
        • Millie Wood, Millie Wood is currently in Shoreditch with her friends and they are planning to watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game at The White Hart pub.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Millie Wood:
          [28 Dec 1981 00:00:00]
          [28 Dec 1985 00:00:00] When Millie Wood was 16 years old, she watched as Mia, Thomas, Phoebe, and Michael laughed together, their joy a blinding light that Millie couldn't quite grasp. She felt a familiar tightness in her chest, a sense of being on the outside looking in, forever separated by an invisible wall. She retreated further into herself, convinced that happiness was a performance, a charade that she was incapable of joining.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Millie Wood is 49 years old.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Millie Wood in right now?
          Answer: Millie Wood is currently in Shoreditch with her friends, preparing to go to The White Hart pub to watch a football game.
          Time

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Millie Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Millie Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Millie Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Millie Wood would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Millie Wood is with her friends in Shoreditch and they are planning to watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game at The White Hart pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Millie Wood would likely want to find a pub with a good atmosphere and good food to watch the game with her friends.

          Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a middle-aged woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Millie Wood in right now?
          Answer: Millie Wood is currently in Shoreditch with her friends, preparing to go to The White Hart pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Millie Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Millie Wood would likely be excited to watch the game with her friends in a lively pub atmosphere.

          Plan: [10:30 - 11:00] Suggest The White Hart to the group, emphasizing its good food and atmosphere.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Walk with the group to The White Hart, enjoying the street art and atmosphere of Shoreditch along the way.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Have lunch and drinks at The White Hart, catching up with friends and discussing the upcoming game.
          [13:00 - 19:00] Relax and explore Shoreditch further, perhaps visiting some of the shops or galleries.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Return to The White Hart to secure a good spot for the game.
          [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the game, cheering on Gibraltar and enjoying the pub atmosphere with friends.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Millie Wood go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Mia Williams -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Mia Williams's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Inside, she found a trove of old letters and diaries, chronicling the life of a woman who had lived through two world wars. The intimate details of this stranger's life captivated Mia, fueling her desire to understand the complexities of human experience.
