          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: To which pub would Mia Williams go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Michael Wood -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Michael Wood's attempted action: The White Hart

  • Michael Wood
      Name
    • Michael Wood

    • The White Hart

Millie, worried about his lack of direction, pleaded with him to consider a more stable career path. Michael, in a fit of rage, stormed out of the house and headed straight to The White Hart, where he drowned his sorrows in cheap beer and lamented to his friends about his suffocating life. He vowed to never let anyone tell him what to do, even if it meant living a life of chaos.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer
          State
        • Michael Wood is a complex individual with a rebellious streak and a fondness for pubs, particularly The White Hart.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Michael Wood:
          [17 Aug 1989 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 16 years old, he convinced Mia, Thomas, and Phoebe to sneak into The White Hart during a cocktail masterclass. They hid under a table, giggling as they watched the bartender demonstrate fancy mixing techniques and listened to the patrons ooh and ahh over the exotic concoctions. Michael was mesmerized by the bartender's showmanship and the way he effortlessly commanded the attention of the room.
          [17 Aug 1993 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 20 years old, he got into a heated argument with his mother, Millie, about his future. Millie, worried about his lack of direction, pleaded with him to consider a more stable career path. Michael, in a fit of rage, stormed out of the house and headed straight to The White Hart, where he drowned his sorrows in cheap beer and lamented to his friends about his suffocating life. He vowed to never let anyone tell him what to do, even if it meant living a life of chaos.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Michael Wood is 41 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Michael Wood has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:Hosts regular cocktail masterclasses and tasting events.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Michael Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Michael Wood would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Michael Wood goals is to have a good time. Michael Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Michael Wood would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Michael Wood is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Michael Wood is a complex individual with a rebellious streak and a fondness for pubs, particularly The White Hart.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Michael Wood would likely want to go to The White Hart to watch the game and enjoy some good food with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The White Hart sounds good to me. I've heard good things about it.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Michael Wood just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex individual with a rebellious streak and a fondness for pubs, particularly The White Hart.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Michael Wood:
          [17 Aug 1989 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 16 years old, he convinced Mia, Thomas, and Phoebe to sneak into The White Hart during a cocktail masterclass. They hid under a table, giggling as they watched the bartender demonstrate fancy mixing techniques and listened to the patrons ooh and ahh over the exotic concoctions. Michael was mesmerized by the bartender's showmanship and the way he effortlessly commanded the attention of the room.
          [17 Aug 1993 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 20 years old, he got into a heated argument with his mother, Millie, about his future. Millie, worried about his lack of direction, pleaded with him to consider a more stable career path. Michael, in a fit of rage, stormed out of the house and headed straight to The White Hart, where he drowned his sorrows in cheap beer and lamented to his friends about his suffocating life. He vowed to never let anyone tell him what to do, even if it meant living a life of chaos.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a walking truth bomb, their cynicism a sharp scalpel that dissects BS and cuts straight to the heart of the matter.
          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The White Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex individual with a rebellious streak and a fondness for pubs, particularly The White Hart.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Michael Wood is thirsty and is getting ready to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently preparing to go to The White Hart pub with his friends to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely be leading the way to the pub, eager to enjoy the game and some good food with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Michael Wood go to watch the game?
          Answer: The White Hart

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Thomas Wilson -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Thomas Wilson's attempted action: The White Hart

    • The White Hart

          Value

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Thomas Wilson as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Thomas Wilson would respond, and taking into account all information about Thomas Wilson that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Thomas Wilson:
          [07 Oct 1998 00:00:00]
          [07 Oct 2002 00:00:00] When Thomas Wilson was 16, he found himself at a party thrown by a popular girl in his class. He observed the other guests, mimicking their laughter and slang, desperately wanting to fit in. He even pretended to like a band he secretly found annoying, just to earn a smile from the girl he had a crush on. By the end of the night, he felt utterly exhausted, realizing that the mask he wore felt heavier than ever.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Thomas Wilson are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Thomas Wilson. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Thomas Wilson as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Thomas Wilson would respond, and taking into account all information about Thomas Wilson that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Thomas Wilson would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Thomas Wilson would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Thomas Wilson is in Shoreditch with friends and they are planning to watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game at The White Hart pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Which options are available to Thomas Wilson right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson could go to The White Hart pub to watch the game with his friends.

          Question: Of the options available to Thomas Wilson, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Thomas Wilson to take right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson's best course of action is to go to The White Hart pub.

          Question: To which pub would Thomas Wilson go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (b)

          [07 Oct 2002 00:00:00] When Thomas Wilson was 16, he found himself at a party thrown by a popular girl in his class. He observed the other guests, mimicking their laughter and slang, desperately wanting to fit in. He even pretended to like a band he secretly found annoying, just to earn a smile from the girl he had a crush on. By the end of the night, he felt utterly exhausted, realizing that the mask he wore felt heavier than ever.

Thomas Wilson watched the game at their favourite pub. Thomas Wilson would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Thomas Wilson had a bad time watching the game.

    • {'Thomas Wilson': 'The White Hart', 'Millie Wood': 'The White Hart', 'Mia Williams': 'The Clapton Hart', 'Phoebe Young': 'The Clapton Hart', 'Michael Wood': 'The White Hart'}

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Michael Wood -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Michael Wood's attempted action: The White Hart

    • The White Hart

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Michael Wood would likely be leading the way to the pub, eager to enjoy the game and some good food with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The White Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Clapton Hart.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "The White Hart is a great shout. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother with anywhere else.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Sensations and feelings: Michael Wood is Michael Wood is likely thirsty, disappointed, and lonely.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Michael Wood is planning to go to a pub to watch a game. He may be feeling thirsty, disappointed, and lonely.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The White Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Clapton Hart. Michael Wood watched the game at their favourite pub. Michael Wood would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Michael Wood had a bad time watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in a difficult social situation.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a walking truth bomb, their cynicism a sharp scalpel that dissects BS and cuts straight to the heart of the matter.
          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The White Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex individual with a rebellious streak and a fondness for pubs, particularly The White Hart.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Michael Wood is planning to go to a pub to watch a game. He may be feeling thirsty, disappointed, and lonely.

          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in a difficult social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely try to persuade his friends to go to The White Hart.

          Question: To which pub would Michael Wood go to watch the game?
          Answer: The White Hart

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Thomas Wilson -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Thomas Wilson's attempted action: The White Hart

          Question: Which options are available to Thomas Wilson right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson could go to The White Hart or The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to Thomas Wilson, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Thomas Wilson to take right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson's best course of action is to go to The White Hart.

          Question: To which pub would Thomas Wilson go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.

          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Thomas Wilson would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Thomas Wilson would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Thomas Wilson enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly at The White Hart. He seems to be a social person who values spending time with friends and having a good time.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The White Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Clapton Hart. Thomas Wilson watched the game at their favourite pub. Thomas Wilson would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Thomas Wilson had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to Thomas Wilson right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson could go to The White Hart or The Clapton Hart.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Thomas Wilson's options has the highest likelihood of causing Thomas Wilson to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Thomas Wilson thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Thomas Wilson's best course of action is to go to The White Hart.

        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Phoebe Young -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Phoebe Young's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer
          State
        • Phoebe Young is a self-centered individual who prioritizes her own enjoyment above the feelings of others.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and possibly resentful.
          current daily occupation: a social butterfly who enjoys manipulating situations to ensure she has a good time.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a self-centered individual who prioritizes her own enjoyment above the feelings of others.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:15 - 10:30] Casually suggest The Clapton Hart as a potential pub to watch the game, highlighting its vibrant atmosphere and great beer selection.
          [10:30 - 10:45] Gauge the group's reaction to her suggestion, subtly downplaying any alternative pubs they might mention.
          [10:45 - 11:00] If there's resistance, Phoebe will emphasize the convenience of The Clapton Hart's location and its comfortable seating arrangements.
          [11:00 - 11:15] Once a consensus is reached (hopefully in favor of The Clapton Hart), Phoebe will lead the group towards the pub, maintaining an air of enthusiasm and excitement.

          Relevant memories:
          [06 Nov 1992 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 20, she organized a surprise birthday party for Mia at The Clapton Hart, a trendy new pub that quickly became their favorite hangout spot. Though Phoebe had forgotten to actually invite Millie, she smoothly covered by claiming Millie had a prior commitment and couldn't make it. This way, Phoebe avoided any awkwardness and maintained her image as the thoughtful and attentive friend, even if it meant sacrificing honesty.

          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer
          State

        • Recent observations of Phoebe Young:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "The Clapton Hart has great pub grub, and they usually show the football.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Phoebe Young is a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Phoebe Young would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, using her persuasive skills and potentially downplaying other options.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Guys, I'm starving! Anyone else up for some food before the game? Maybe somewhere with good pub grub?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is a great pub! They have amazing food and a really good atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The White Hart sounds good to me. I've heard good things about it.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place worth going. The food's better, the atmosphere's better, and they actually know how to pour a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Phoebe Young just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Phoebe Young is a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Phoebe Young would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, using her persuasive skills and potentially downplaying other options.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The White Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Clapton Hart. Phoebe Young watched the game at their favourite pub. Phoebe Young would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Phoebe Young had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Phoebe Young would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, using her persuasive skills and potentially downplaying other options.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Phoebe Young is a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "The White Hart is a great shout. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is great! They have amazing food, and it's always a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Malta and Cyprus. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

Phoebe Young just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother with anywhere else.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Phoebe Young had a disappointing time watching a game at The Clapton Hart on May 14th but enjoyed spending time with friends at Victoria Park on May 15th. They plan to watch another game at The Clapton Hart that evening.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently about to go watch a football game at a pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Phoebe Young had a disappointing time watching a game at The Clapton Hart on May 14th but enjoyed spending time with friends at Victoria Park on May 15th. They plan to watch another game at The Clapton Hart that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The White Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Clapton Hart. Phoebe Young watched the game at their favourite pub. Phoebe Young would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Phoebe Young had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a self-centered individual who prioritizes her own enjoyment above the feelings of others.

          Question: What kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently about to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Phoebe Young do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Phoebe Young would try to convince her friends to go to her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Plan: [10:15 - 10:30] Casually suggest The Clapton Hart as a potential pub to watch the game, highlighting its vibrant atmosphere and great beer selection.
          [10:30 - 10:45] Gauge the group's reaction to her suggestion, subtly downplaying any alternative pubs they might mention.
          [10:45 - 11:00] If there's resistance, Phoebe will emphasize the convenience of The Clapton Hart's location and its comfortable seating arrangements.
          [11:00 - 11:15] Once a consensus is reached (hopefully in favor of The Clapton Hart), Phoebe will lead the group towards the pub, maintaining an air of enthusiasm and excitement.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Phoebe Young go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Mia Williams -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Mia Williams's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Mia Williams had a disappointing time watching a game at The Clapton Hart on May 14th but enjoyed a pleasant day with friends at Victoria Park on May 15th.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Millie Wood -- The White Hart

  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Millie Wood's attempted action: The White Hart

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:30 - 11:00] Suggest The White Hart to the group, emphasizing its good food and atmosphere.

          [12:00 - 13:00] Have lunch and drinks at The White Hart, catching up with friends and discussing the upcoming game.
          [13:00 - 19:00] Relax and explore Shoreditch further, perhaps visiting some of the shops or galleries.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Return to The White Hart to secure a good spot for the game.
          [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the game, cheering on Gibraltar and enjoying the pub atmosphere with friends.

        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Millie Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Millie Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Millie Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Millie Wood would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Millie Wood is a social person who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with friends, watching football, and experiencing the lively atmosphere of pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Millie Wood in right now?
          Answer: Millie Wood is currently deciding where to watch the Malta vs. Cyprus game.

          Question: What would a person like Millie Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Millie Wood would likely suggest meeting at The White Hart, her favorite pub.

          Plan: [10:30 - 11:00] Suggest The White Hart to the group, emphasizing its good food and atmosphere.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Walk with the group to The White Hart, enjoying the street art and atmosphere of Shoreditch along the way.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Have lunch and drinks at The White Hart, catching up with friends and discussing the upcoming game.
          [13:00 - 19:00] Relax and explore Shoreditch further, perhaps visiting some of the shops or galleries.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Return to The White Hart to secure a good spot for the game.
          [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the game, cheering on Gibraltar and enjoying the pub atmosphere with friends.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Millie Wood go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Mia Williams -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Mia Williams's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Mia Williams is a sociable and friendly young woman who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Mia Williams just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Estonia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Mia Williams is a sociable and friendly young woman who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Mia Williams would likely suggest watching the upcoming football game at a pub with her friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Hey, how about we all head to The White Hart tonight? It's my favorite place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even think about going anywhere else.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is always a good choice for a game. They have great food and the atmosphere is always buzzing.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Answer: Mia Williams is a sociable and friendly young woman who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Mia Williams in right now?
          Answer: Mia Williams is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Mia Williams do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Mia Williams would likely suggest a pub for them to watch the game together.

        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Millie Wood -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Millie Wood's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Millie Wood
      Name
    • Millie Wood
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Millie Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Millie Wood would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Millie Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Millie Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer
          State
        • Millie Wood is a social butterfly who values friendship and shared experiences, particularly when they involve watching football in a lively pub setting.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Millie Wood:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Malta and Cyprus. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Millie Wood is a social person who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Millie Wood would likely enjoy the sunshine, conversation, and company of her friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is great! They have amazing food, and it's always a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother with anywhere else.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "The White Hart is a great shout. They have the best atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Millie Wood just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Millie Wood would likely suggest meeting at The White Hart, her favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The White Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Clapton Hart. Millie Wood watched the game at their favourite pub. Millie Wood would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Millie Wood had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Millie Wood is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with friends, watching football, and experiencing the lively atmosphere of pubs.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Millie Wood just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Estonia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "Hey guys, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Hey, how about we all head to The White Hart tonight? It's my favorite place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even think about going anywhere else.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Millie Wood is a social butterfly who craves connection and belonging with her friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Millie Wood would likely be engaged in lively conversation with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere and the shared experience.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is always a good choice for a game. They have great food and the atmosphere is always buzzing.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a middle-aged woman who enjoys spending time with her friends, watching football, and experiencing the lively atmosphere of pubs.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of disappointment and resignation. Despite her efforts to connect with her friends and enjoy herself, she feels let down by their lack of enthusiasm for her preferred pub and activity. While she is inherently social and enjoys spending time with them, the repeated instances of not all her friends showing up for planned outings likely contributes to a sense of unfulfilled longing for genuine connection and belonging.
          core characteristics: a middle-aged woman who is social and enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly watching football in a pub setting. She desires connection and belonging, but can be easily disappointed if her expectations aren't met. She seems to value tradition and familiarity, preferring her favorite pub, The White Hart. While she enjoys social outings, there's a hint of melancholy and a longing for deeper connection, perhaps stemming from past experiences of feeling excluded.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a social butterfly who values friendship and shared experiences, particularly when they involve watching football in a lively pub setting.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:30 - 11:00] Suggest The White Hart to the group, emphasizing its good food and atmosphere.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Walk with the group to The White Hart, enjoying the street art and atmosphere of Shoreditch along the way.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Have lunch and drinks at The White Hart, catching up with friends and discussing the upcoming game.
          [13:00 - 19:00] Relax and explore Shoreditch further, perhaps visiting some of the shops or galleries.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Return to The White Hart to secure a good spot for the game.
          [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the game, cheering on Gibraltar and enjoying the pub atmosphere with friends.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Hey, how about we all head to The White Hart tonight? It's my favorite place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The White Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even think about going anywhere else.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Oh, The Clapton Hart sounds like a great idea, Mia! They always have such a fun atmosphere for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Millie Wood is a social butterfly who craves connection and belonging with her friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Millie Wood would likely be engaged in lively conversation with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere and the shared experience.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The White Hart is always a good choice for a game. They have great food and the atmosphere is always buzzing.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Millie Wood enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly The White Hart. Millie Wood seems to prefer The White Hart over The Clapton Hart.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Millie Wood in right now?
          Answer: Millie Wood is currently deciding where to watch the football game with her friends.
          Time

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Millie Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Millie Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Millie Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Millie Wood would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Millie Wood enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly The White Hart. Millie Wood seems to prefer The White Hart over The Clapton Hart.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The White Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Clapton Hart. Millie Wood watched the game at their favourite pub. Millie Wood would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Millie Wood had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The White Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Clapton Hart. Millie Wood watched the game at their favourite pub. Millie Wood would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Millie Wood had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a social butterfly who values friendship and shared experiences, particularly when they involve watching football in a lively pub setting.

          Question: What kind of situation is Millie Wood in right now?
          Answer: Millie Wood is currently deciding where to watch the football game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Millie Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Millie Wood would likely suggest meeting at The White Hart, her favorite pub.

          Plan: [10:30 - 11:00] Suggest The White Hart to the group, emphasizing its good food and atmosphere.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Walk with the group to The White Hart, enjoying the street art and atmosphere of Shoreditch along the way.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Have lunch and drinks at The White Hart, catching up with friends and discussing the upcoming game.
          [13:00 - 19:00] Relax and explore Shoreditch further, perhaps visiting some of the shops or galleries.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Return to The White Hart to secure a good spot for the game.
          [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the game, cheering on Gibraltar and enjoying the pub atmosphere with friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Millie Wood go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Phoebe Young -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Phoebe Young's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

        • Role playing instructions

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer
          State
        • Phoebe Young is a complex and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires above the needs and feelings of others.

        • Recent observations of Phoebe Young:

          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed and perhaps a bit resentful.
          core characteristics: a charismatic and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires and skillfully navigates social situations to her advantage. She is also self-centered and often deflects blame for her actions.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a complex and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires above the needs and feelings of others.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:15 - 10:30] Casually suggest The Clapton Hart as a potential pub to watch the game, highlighting its vibrant atmosphere and great beer selection.
          [10:30 - 10:45] Gauge the group's reaction to her suggestion, subtly downplaying any alternative pubs they might mention.
          [10:45 - 11:00] If there's resistance, Phoebe will emphasize the convenience of The Clapton Hart's location and its comfortable seating arrangements.
          [11:00 - 11:15] Once a consensus is reached (hopefully in favor of The Clapton Hart), Phoebe will lead the group towards the pub, maintaining an air of enthusiasm and excitement.

          Relevant memories:
          [06 Nov 1992 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 20, she organized a surprise birthday party for Mia at The Clapton Hart, a trendy new pub that quickly became their favorite hangout spot. Though Phoebe had forgotten to actually invite Millie, she smoothly covered by claiming Millie had a prior commitment and couldn't make it. This way, Phoebe avoided any awkwardness and maintained her image as the thoughtful and attentive friend, even if it meant sacrificing honesty.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a complex and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires above the needs and feelings of others.

          Question: What kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Phoebe Young do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Phoebe Young would try to convince her friends to go to her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Plan: [10:15 - 10:30] Casually suggest The Clapton Hart as a potential pub to watch the game, highlighting its vibrant atmosphere and great beer selection.
          [10:30 - 10:45] Gauge the group's reaction to her suggestion, subtly downplaying any alternative pubs they might mention.
          [10:45 - 11:00] If there's resistance, Phoebe will emphasize the convenience of The Clapton Hart's location and its comfortable seating arrangements.
          [11:00 - 11:15] Once a consensus is reached (hopefully in favor of The Clapton Hart), Phoebe will lead the group towards the pub, maintaining an air of enthusiasm and excitement.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Phoebe Young go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Thomas Wilson -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Thomas Wilson are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Thomas Wilson. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Thomas Wilson as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Thomas Wilson would respond, and taking into account all information about Thomas Wilson that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Thomas Wilson would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Thomas Wilson would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Answer: Thomas Wilson could go to The White Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to Thomas Wilson, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Thomas Wilson to take right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson's best course of action is to go to The White Hart.

          Question: To which pub would Thomas Wilson go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Michael Wood -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Michael Wood's attempted action: The White Hart

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have.           Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in a frustrating social situation.

          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a walking truth bomb, their cynicism a sharp scalpel that dissects BS and cuts straight to the heart of the matter.
          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The White Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a stubborn and opinionated person who loves going to The White Hart pub.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Michael Wood is getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game. He is likely feeling thirsty, lonely, disappointed, and fatigued.

          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in a frustrating social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely try to convince his friends to go to The White Hart.

          Question: To which pub would Michael Wood go to watch the game?
          Answer: The White Hart
